info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 1:22PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES IN FALLING SNOW THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS... WEATHER... * Moderate to occasional bursts of heavy snow will impact southeastern Michigan through the remainder of the afternoon hours. * Hourly snowfall rates will approach up to 1 inch per hour at times, especially south of the I-69 corridor. * Snow accumulations through 5 PM will range generally between 1 and 2 inches in the Detroit metro region, 1 to 3 inches in portions of the eastern Thumb, and up to 2 inches in remaining portions of southeast Michigan. Where embedded bursts of heavier snow occur, localized heavier snowfall totals may occur. IMPACTS... * Visibilities will be around a quarter of a mile at times due to moderate to heavy snow. Rapid fluctuations of visibility are likely. * Where heavier bursts of snow occur, accumulating snow may lead to slippery roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. * Temperatures in the mid to upper 30s will make it difficult for snow to accumulate on area roadways, especially those that are treated. Most of the snowfall accumulation will occur on grassy and elevated surfaces, with roadways primarily remaining wet and slushy. However, where higher snowfall rates occur, snow covered roadways will be possible. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Snow will result in localized slippery conditions and variable traffic rates throughout the county. Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
